intro: Vincetoxicum brownii, commonly known as the brown's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in umbels. It is often found in moist, woodsy areas and can grow up to 3 feet tall. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
